intro: Macromiscus, commonly known as the common macromiscus, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. These plants are typically herbaceous and can be found in various habitats across temperate regions. They are characterized by their composite flower heads, which consist of both ray and disk flowers. Macromiscus species often have narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produce small, inconspicuous flowers that are arranged in clusters. The genus is notable for its adaptability and ability to thrive in disturbed soils and open habitats.
